snippet: Someone mysteriously changed the Mets’ 53-year-old logo on the team’s social media accounts for a few days, replacing the United Nations headquarters with the Citigroup Center.
abstract: MLB Roundup; logo on New York Mets website is mysteriously changed, inserting Citigroup Center in place of the United Nations headquarters in background skyline; remains unclear whether incident, which lasted only a few days, was result of hacking or an internal joke.
lead_paragraph: Someone mysteriously changed the Mets’ 53-year-old logo on the team’s social media accounts for a few days, replacing the United Nations headquarters with the Citigroup Center.

headline.main: Alteration to Mets Logo on Twitter and Facebook Draws Attention
headline.print_headline: Change to Mets’ Logo on Social Media Takes On a Mysterious Angle
